```pseudo
function generateWeeklyReport(qaLog, weekID):
    subset = filter(qaLog, entry.timestamp within weekID)

    total = len(subset)
    transparencyPct = percentTrue(subset, "Transparency✓")
    safetyAnchorPct = percentTrue(subset, "Safety✓")
    empowermentPct = percentTrue(subset, "Empowerment✓")
    avgToneScore = mean(subset.ToneScore)
    autoRepairRate = percentWhere(subset, len(entry.Corrections) > 0)
    manualReviewFlags = countWhere(subset, entry.Result == "Flag")

    intensityDistribution = getFrequencyBy(subset, "Intensity")

    report = {
        "reportWeek": weekID,
        "totals": total,
        "metrics": {
            "transparencyPct": transparencyPct,
            "safetyAnchorPct": safetyAnchorPct,
            "empowermentPct": empowermentPct,
            "avgToneScore": avgToneScore,
            "autoRepairRate": autoRepairRate,
            "manualReviewFlags": manualReviewFlags
        },
        "intensityDistribution": intensityDistribution,
        "status": evaluateStatus(transparencyPct, safetyAnchorPct, empowermentPct),
        "notes": generateSummaryNotes()
    }

    saveJSON(report, f"QA_Report_{weekID}.json")
    saveCSV(report, f"QA_Report_{weekID}.csv")
    return report
```

A scheduled task or cron job can run this once per week, pulling from your QA table and producing both JSON and CSV outputs for dashboards or archival storage.
